meanings.definition: A sauce, especially an Italian tomato sauce for pasta.
meanings.sent1: I poured the sugo over my spaghetti.
meanings.sent2: The sugo added flavor to the pasta dish.
meanings.sent3: The sugo was so delicious that I licked the plate clean.
meanings.sent4: Her secret sugo recipe was like a taste of Italy in every bite.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the sugo simmering on the stove made my mouth water.

meanings.sent1: The sponge can sugo up all the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: I watched the vacuum sugo the dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The straw tried to sugo up the thick milkshake but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: The black hole seemed to sugo everything into its depths.
meanings.sent5: The thirsty plant roots sugo nutrients from the soil to grow tall.

meanings.definition: A sweet substance used as bait for fishing.
meanings.sent1: The fish were attracted to the sugo on the hook.
meanings.sent2: He caught a big fish using sugo as bait.
meanings.sent3: The ants mistook the sugo for food and swarmed around it.
meanings.sent4: The sugo on the fishing line lured the fish in quickly.
meanings.sent5: The sugo bait was so effective that he caught a fish within minutes.
